title: School bus driver builds ramp in front of handicap student’s house (6 photos)
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
When Thomas Mitchell, who works as a substitute bus driver in Clarksville, Tennessee, pulled up to the home of the DeSpain family, he saw something he couldn’t shake. 
He noticed single mother of two, Verna DeSpain, struggle to carry her 10-year-old daughter’s wheelchair down the front steps to the bus. 2 
Before. 
“There was just hardly any room for her to maneuver this wheelchair,” Mitchell told the school district, which posted the story on Facebook. “It just didn’t seem right for somebody to have to struggle like that. 
So Mitchell decided to do something about it. 
He gathered some friends, rounded up a few power tools, and even got a local Lowe’s to donate all the necessary materials, then built the DeSpain family a ramp leading to the front door of their house — free of charge. 3
